chunk.textFormat: When replacing the oil filter it is important to take care of the environmental issue as well, the used oil and filter must be disposed in an proper way.

Warm oil
Puncture the filter before you start removing the filter
Follow information on the filter and Impact
Take care of old oil and filter in a correct way
Go through the information below. Show the participants how they shall do it before they do it.

1. Warm up the engine
2. Puncture the filter before it is removed
3. Tap off the old oil
4. Loose the oil filter
5. Add a thin layer of oil on the rubber sealant on the new oil filter
6. Fill up the new oil filter with oil before it is mounted. This makes the oil pressure to rise more quickly when the engine is starting.
7. The oil filter

only be hand tighted.
8. Fill up oil in the engine to the correct level.
9. Start the engine and check for leakage around the filter and the oil plug.
10. Turn off the engine and check the oil level on the dip stick. Add oil if necessary.
11. Old oil and filters should be desposed and stored according to the local waste management direction.
This information can be different depending on which engine you are working on, following Impact.
